[#How To Create and Cultivate A Minimum Viable Audience]

bit.title: How To Create and Cultivate A Minimum Viable Audience

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:194456]
Ask questions and listen without the intent to reply, learn with an open mind, share what you know through content, and repeat. Then, when the time is ready, you can offer your audience a solution they really need.

bit.body: Ask questions and listen without the intent to reply, learn with an open mind, share what you know through content, and repeat. Then, when the time is ready, you can offer your audience a solution they really need.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:194457]
1. Start with a vision, a passion, or an intention but without expectations or assumptions. Only with an open mind can you fully listen.

bit.body: 1. Start with a vision, a passion, or an intention but without expectations or assumptions. Only with an open mind can you fully listen.

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:194458]
2. Instead of a product idea or a concrete solution, start with a question. Google does it with their “How might we ..” questions. Instead of assuming women want a single-use plastic glove to remove their tampons, ask: How might we make menstrual products more convenient for women?

bit.body: 2. Instead of a product idea or a concrete solution, start with a question. Google does it with their “How might we ..” questions. Instead of assuming women want a single-use plastic glove to remove their tampons, ask: How might we make menstrual products more convenient for women?

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:194459]

bit.body: 3. Create a social channel and start asking people about their opinion

bitmark:
[.article:bitmark--]
[@id:194460]
4. Listen, learn, and educate others with what you learned. Through content creation, you’ll find the sweet spot of listening and presenting yourself as an authority.

bit.body: 4. Listen, learn, and educate others with what you learned. Through content creation, you’ll find the sweet spot of listening and presenting yourself as an authority.

bitmark:

[@id:194461]
